cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a new algorithm for adversarial training in deep learning classification applications, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several sub-fields in computer science. Given that the paper focuses on image recognition tasks, it is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a new algorithm for training deep learning models, which is a topic that falls under the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also discusses the trade-off between accuracy and robustness, which is a topic that falls under the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Furthermore, the paper deals with adversarial attacks, which is a topic that falls under the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes an optimal transport problem on the output space of the network, which is a topic that falls under the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
